The Cat in the Hat.plot: Two bored children have their lives turned upside down when a talking cat comes to visit them.

Running with Scissors.name: Running with Scissors
Running with Scissors.plot: A teenage boy comes of age in the 1970's, sent by his neurotic, pretentious mother to live with a jolly, vulgar psychiatrist and his eccentric extended family.

Fallen.name: Fallen
Fallen.plot: Homicide detective John Hobbes witnesses the execution of serial killer Edgar Reese. Soon after the execution, the killings start again, and they are very similar to Reese's style.

A Christmas Carol.name: A Christmas Carol
A Christmas Carol.plot: A radical animated retelling of the holiday classic that starts with a Victorian performance of the Charles Dickens tale before diving into the imagination of one of the children in the audience, taking the story to a darker fantasy realm.

The Guernsey Literary and Potato Peel Pi.name: The Guernsey Literary and Potato Peel Pie Society
The Guernsey Literary and Potato Peel Pi.plot: In the aftermath of World War II, a writer forms an unexpected bond with the residents of Guernsey Island when she decides to write a book about their experiences during the war. Then she learns the secret they are afraid to reveal.

The Other Boleyn Girl.name: The Other Boleyn Girl
The Other Boleyn Girl.plot: Two sisters contend for the affection of King Henry VIII.

Beautiful Creatures.name: Beautiful Creatures
Beautiful Creatures.plot: Two girls thrown together by their boyfriends' violence accidentally kill one of them.

Siddhartha.name: Siddhartha
Siddhartha.plot: The story of a young Indian who embarks upon a journey to find the meaning of existence. Based on the novel by Hermann Hesse.

The Bell Jar.name: The Bell Jar
The Bell Jar.plot: As the horrors beneath the idealized 1950s come about, a successful young woman finds herself having a serious mental breakdown when she returns to New England.

Emma.name: Emma
Emma.plot: After decades of raising the motherless Smith children, housekeeper Emma Thatcher is faced with resentment when she marries their father.

Great Expectations.name: Great Expectations
Great Expectations.plot: Modernization of Charles Dickens' classic story finds the hapless Finn as a painter in New York City pursuing his unrequited and haughty childhood love.

The Red Tent.name: The Red Tent
The Red Tent.plot: Torn by personal guilt, Italian General Umberto Nobile reminisces about his failed 1928 Arctic expedition aboard the airship Italia.

The Scarlet Letter.name: The Scarlet Letter
The Scarlet Letter.plot: In the seventeenth century, in Massachusetts, a young woman is forced to wear a scarlet "A" on her dress for bearing a child out of wedlock.

Divine Secrets of the Ya-Ya Sisterhood.name: Divine Secrets of the Ya-Ya Sisterhood
Divine Secrets of the Ya-Ya Sisterhood.plot: After years of mother-daughter tension, Siddalee receives a scrapbook detailing the wild adventures of the "Ya-Yas", her mother's girlhood friends.

The Grapes of Wrath.name: The Grapes of Wrath
genre: Great Depression in the United States
The Grapes of Wrath.plot: An Oklahoma family, driven off their farm by the poverty and hopelessness of the Dust Bowl, joins the westward migration to California, suffering the misfortunes of the homeless in the Great Depression.

The Old Man and the Sea.name: The Old Man and the Sea
The Old Man and the Sea.plot: An old Cuban fisherman's dry spell is broken when he hooks a gigantic fish that drags him out to sea.

Lolita.name: Lolita
Lolita.plot: A middle-aged college professor becomes infatuated with a 14-year-old girl.

The Handmaid's Tale.name: The Handmaid's Tale
The Handmaid's Tale.plot: Under a dystopian religious tyranny, most women cannot conceive children. Those young women who can live in a form of sexual slavery to provide children for influential families.

The Joy Luck Club.name: The Joy Luck Club
The Joy Luck Club.plot: The life histories of four East Asian women and their daughters reflect and guide each other.

The Adventures of Tom Sawyer.name: The Adventures of Tom Sawyer
The Adventures of Tom Sawyer.plot: In the 1840s, two boys get mixed up with an Indian accused of stealing money and rescue a pretty girl who is trapped in a cave.

Catch-22.name: Catch-22
Catch-22.plot: A man is trying desperately to be certified insane during World War II, so he can stop flying missions.

The Picture of Dorian Gray.name: The Picture of Dorian Gray
The Picture of Dorian Gray.plot: Dorian is tutored by reclusive actress Lady Wotton for Lady Macbeth role. Wotton's granddaughter photographs Dorian and they grow close. Their relationship appears innocent but a sinister curse may be at work.

The Secret Garden.name: The Secret Garden
The Secret Garden.plot: A taut psychological thriller, The Secret Garden stars AJ Cross as Peter Sebastian, a lone spy who must face a global threat that may wreak havoc upon all Americans. Based on the story The Garden of Forking Paths, The Secret Garden is a classic spy movie with all the trappings of a classic spy novel. Full of intrigue and contrivance, The Secret Garden brings a classic spy hero to life who must face the ultimate challenge- to avert a nuclear war and rely solely on his survival skills to cope with his mission. Peter must act fast to stop the terrorists before they are able to carry out their devious plan. Will Peter win out in the end? Or will the terrorists get the upper hand? Find out in this highly intense original movie that is the standard of all spy movies. And unite for a hero that will live on as the ultimate spy reconnoiter since the advent of James Bond.

A Time to Kill.name: A Time to Kill
A Time to Kill.plot: In Canton, Mississippi, a fearless young lawyer and his assistant defend a black man accused of murdering two white men who raped his ten-year-old daughter, inciting violent retribution and revenge from the Ku Klux Klan.

The Giving Tree.name: The Giving Tree
The Giving Tree.plot: Nine former schoolmates are invited to a cabin for a reunion, but their hostess commits suicide. They all try to figure out why.

A Tale of Two Cities.name: A Tale of Two Cities
A Tale of Two Cities.plot: Alcoholic lawyer Sydney Carton travels to Paris during the Reign of Terror to rescue French aristocrat Charles Darnay, husband of the woman he loves.

The Glass Castle.name: The Glass Castle
The Glass Castle.plot: A young girl comes of age in a dysfunctional family of nonconformist nomads with a mother who's an eccentric artist and an alcoholic father who would stir the children's imagination with hope as a distraction to their poverty.

Holes.name: Holes
Holes.plot: Two young men come running out of a dark alley, leaving behind another young man with his neck stabbed. The moment Danny received the message about the murder of Itzik, his only son, his life would never again be the same. Ten years of legal proceedings and new disclosures made during that time have slowly crumbled his faith in gaining justice. Along with the pain of his loss, he realizes that only he can find the truth of what happened that night. His journey in search of the truth reveals his complex identity for the first time: a spy who worked for the security services, an Arab who converted and became a practicing Jew, a man who felt pride, respect and sympathy for a country that has absurdly and horrifyingly betrayed him.

The Shining.name: The Shining
The Shining.plot: A family heads to an isolated hotel for the winter where a sinister presence influences the father into violence, while his psychic son sees horrific forebodings from both past and future.

Wuthering Heights.name: Wuthering Heights
Wuthering Heights.plot: A poor boy of unknown origins is rescued from poverty and taken in by the Earnshaw family where he develops an intense relationship with his young foster sister, Cathy.

The Curious Incident of the Dog in the N.name: The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-Time
The Curious Incident of the Dog in the N.plot: An autistic 15-year-old replicates the methods of Sherlock Holmes to discover who killed his neighbor's dog with a garden tool.

The Book Thief.name: The Book Thief
The Book Thief.plot: While subjected to the horrors of World War II Germany, young Liesel finds solace by stealing books and sharing them with others. In the basement of her home, a Jewish refugee is being protected by her adoptive parents.

Life of Pi.name: Life of Pi
Life of Pi.plot: A young man who survives a disaster at sea is hurtled into an epic journey of adventure and discovery. While cast away, he forms an unexpected connection with another survivor: a fearsome Bengal tiger.

Little Women.name: Little Women
Little Women.plot: The March sisters live and grow in post-Civil War America.

The Giver.name: The Giver
The Giver.plot: In a seemingly perfect community without war, pain, suffering, differences or choices, a young boy is chosen to learn from an elderly man, the true pain and pleasure of the "real" world.

Of Mice and Men.name: Of Mice and Men
Of Mice and Men.plot: This landmark revival of Nobel Prize winner John Steinbeck's play is a powerful portrait of the American spirit and a heart-breaking testament to the bonds of friendship.

Lord of the Flies.name: Lord of the Flies
Lord of the Flies.plot: Stranded on an island, a group of schoolboys degenerate into savagery.

The Lovely Bones.name: The Lovely Bones
The Lovely Bones.plot: Centers on a young girl who has been murdered and watches over her family - and her killer - from purgatory. She must weigh her desire for vengeance against her desire for her family to heal.

Pride and Prejudice.name: Pride and Prejudice
Pride and Prejudice.plot: The EDL have never been known to be an understanding bunch so when they came to Bristol on the day of a Pride march in the city Ted decided that this would be ideal time to find out what exactly motivates the "Living embodiment of The Daily Mail" pride or prejudice.

To Kill a Mockingbird.name: To Kill a Mockingbird
To Kill a Mockingbird.plot: Atticus Finch, a widowed lawyer in Depression-era Alabama, defends a Black man against an undeserved rape charge, and tries to educate his young children against prejudice.

Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them.name: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them
Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them.plot: In 1926, magizoologist Newt Scamander arrives in New York during his worldwide tour to research and rescue magical creatures as something mysterious leaves trails of destruction in the city, threatening to expose the wizarding world.

Carry On.name: Carry On
Carry On.plot: A mysterious traveler blackmails a young TSA agent into let a dangerous package slip through security and onto a Christmas Day flight.

All My Sons.name: All My Sons
All My Sons.plot: During WW2, industrialist Joe Keller commits a crime and frames his business partner Herbert Deever but years later his sin comes back to haunt him when Joe's son plans to marry Deever's daughter.

Cat on a Hot Tin Roof.name: Cat on a Hot Tin Roof
Cat on a Hot Tin Roof.plot: Brick is an alcoholic ex-football player who drinks his days away and resists the affections of his wife. A reunion with his terminal father jogs a host of memories and revelations for both father and son.

The Glass Menagerie.name: The Glass Menagerie
The Glass Menagerie.plot: A son longs to escape from his stifling home, where his genteel mother worries about the future prospects of his lame, shy sister.

A Streetcar Named Desire.name: A Streetcar Named Desire
A Streetcar Named Desire.plot: Disturbed Blanche DuBois moves in with her sister in New Orleans and is tormented by her brutish brother-in-law while her reality crumbles around her.

The Importance of Being Earnest.name: The Importance of Being Earnest
The Importance of Being Earnest.plot: Why would the same man call himself "John" in the country and "Ernest" in the town?

A Walk in the Woods.name: A Walk in the Woods
A Walk in the Woods.plot: After spending two decades in England, Bill Bryson (Robert Redford) returns to the U.S., where he decides the best way to connect with his homeland is to hike the Appalachian Trail with one of his oldest friends, Stephen Katz (Nick Nolte).

The Hunger Games.name: The Hunger Games
The Hunger Games.plot: Katniss Everdeen voluntarily takes her younger sister's place in the Hunger Games: a televised competition in which two teenagers from each of the twelve Districts of Panem are chosen at random to fight to the death.

The Abyss.name: The Abyss
The Abyss.plot: Frigga, who tries to balance her risky job as a security manager in the Kiirunavaara mine with her family life, has to fight for her life and the lives of her loved ones when her city starts collapsing into the mine.

Winter's Tale.name: Winter's Tale
Winter's Tale.plot: A burglar falls for an heiress as she dies in his arms. When he learns that he has the gift of reincarnation, he sets out to save her.

The Wolf of Wall Street.name: The Wolf of Wall Street
The Wolf of Wall Street.plot: A ruthless stockbroker sells short in the copper business and ruins the life of his friends by ruining their finances.

Abraham Lincoln: Vampire Hunter.name: Abraham Lincoln: Vampire Hunter
Abraham Lincoln: Vampire Hunter.plot: Abraham Lincoln, the 16th President of the United States, discovers vampires are planning to take over the United States. He makes it his mission to eliminate them.

The 5th Wave.name: The 5th Wave
The 5th Wave.plot: Four waves of increasingly deadly alien attacks have left most of Earth in ruin. Cassie is on the run, desperately trying to save her younger brother.

Before I Go to Sleep.name: Before I Go to Sleep
Before I Go to Sleep.plot: A woman wakes up every day, remembering nothing as a result of a traumatic accident in her past. One day, new terrifying truths emerge that force her to question everyone around her.

Breakfast of Champions.name: Breakfast of Champions
Breakfast of Champions.plot: A rich car dealer is losing his mind. His son lives in the bomb shelter. His suicidal wife has an affair with his transvestite sales manager.

Still Alice.name: Still Alice
Still Alice.plot: A linguistics professor and her family find their bonds tested when she is diagnosed with Alzheimer's Disease.

Something Borrowed.name: Something Borrowed
Something Borrowed.plot: Friendships are tested and secrets come to the surface when terminally single Rachel falls for Dex, her best friend Darcy's fiancé.

If I Stay.name: If I Stay
If I Stay.plot: Life changes in an instant for young Mia Hall after a car accident puts her in a coma. During an out-of-body experience, she must decide whether to wake up and live a life far different than she had imagined. The choice is hers if she can go on.

Anne of Green Gables.name: Anne of Green Gables
Anne of Green Gables.plot: A romantic teenage girl is adopted by a pair of elderly siblings in turn-of-the-century Canada.

Dune.name: Dune
Dune.plot: A Duke's son leads desert warriors against the galactic emperor and his father's evil nemesis to free their desert world from the emperor's rule.

Me Before You.name: Me Before You
Me Before You.plot: A girl in a small town forms an unlikely bond with a recently-paralyzed man she's taking care of.

The Maze Runner.name: The Maze Runner
The Maze Runner.plot: Thomas is deposited in a community of boys after his memory is erased, soon learning they're all trapped in a maze that will require him to join forces with fellow "runners" for a shot at escape.

Paper Towns.name: Paper Towns
Paper Towns.plot: After an all-night adventure, Quentin's lifelong crush, Margo, disappears, leaving behind clues that Quentin and his friends follow on the journey of a lifetime.

Charlotte's Web.name: Charlotte's Web
Charlotte's Web.plot: Wilbur is a farm pig who's terrified that he'll end up on the dinner table. His friend Charlotte, a charming spider, comes to his rescue. She weaves words into her web, convincing the farmer that Wilbur is too special a pig to kill.

The Notebook.name: The Notebook
The Notebook.plot: An elderly man reads to a woman with dementia the story of two young lovers whose romance is threatened by the difference in their respective social classes.

Fifty Shades of Grey.name: Fifty Shades of Grey
Fifty Shades of Grey.plot: Literature student Anastasia Steele's life changes forever when she meets handsome, yet tormented, billionaire Christian Grey.

The Fault in Our Stars.name: The Fault in Our Stars
The Fault in Our Stars.plot: Hazel and Gus are teenagers who meet at a cancer support group and fall in love. They both share the same acerbic wit and a love of books, especially "An Imperial Affliction", so they embark on a journey to visit an author in Amsterdam.

In Watermelon Sugar.name: In Watermelon Sugar
In Watermelon Sugar.plot: iDEATH is a place where the sun shines a different colour every day and where people travel to the length of their dreams. Rejecting the violence and hate of the old gang at the Forgotten Works, they lead gentle lives in watermelon sugar.

To Build a Fire.name: To Build a Fire
To Build a Fire.plot: Based off of the version of this story Jack London wanted to write. A man goes traveling alone with his dog with the temperature -50 and it is getting colder and colder.

The Woodlanders.name: The Woodlanders
The Woodlanders.plot: The story is set in late 19th century rural corner of South England. The daughter of timber merchant Melbury, Grace, returns to the town after finishing school. Her father now believes she can find a better husband than her childhood sweetheart, woodsman Giles. She marries handsome young doctor FitzPiers, but soon finds out he's not the man of her dreams and she still loves Giles.

The Professor.name: The Professor
The Professor.plot: A college professor lives his life with reckless abandon after being diagnosed with a terminal illness.

The Dot.name: The Dot
The Dot.plot: Narrated by actress Thora Birch, The Dot explores a young animator Vashti as she struggles. In this inspiring story, she fears she can't drawn well enough only to fight through it and find her way to self.expression.

Tom's Midnight Garden.name: Tom's Midnight Garden
Tom's Midnight Garden.plot: A young boy journeys across the boundaries of reality to a secret, haunted place, half-a-century back in time, in this tale of enchantment, shadows and lost memories.

Milkweed.name: Milkweed
Milkweed.plot: When greed and corruption devastate the world of his unrequited love, a dangerously disordered man connects to a wildlife hive-mind and begins a bizarre stalking journey centering around a small child in the forest.

Haunted.name: Haunted
Haunted.plot: When the bomb comes the first thing we do is to run away, later we remember and think of everything we left behind. We did not bid farewell to our homes, memories, photos, identities and life that passed. It is about how homes haunt the life of the souls that were living in them, as much as they themselves haunt the houses.

The Future of Us.name: The Future of Us
The Future of Us.plot: An adventure set in the future about the lives of the 3 kids learning to find their way in this future world, and finding themselves mixed up in a lot of trouble.

Lord of Misrule.name: Lord of Misrule
Lord of Misrule.plot: A desperate search for the young daughter of the town's new minister.

Player Piano.name: Player Piano
Player Piano.plot: Rarity is trying to move a grand piano into the band room for practice, so she gets the Diamond Boys to help her. At Pinkie Pie's suggestion, Rarity tries a keytar, and finds she likes it.

Night Pleasures.name: Night Pleasures
Night Pleasures.plot: A noirish, dark and seedy tale of a sleazy San Francisco bar.

The Last Colony.name: The Last Colony
The Last Colony.plot: A close look at Puerto Rico's unique relationship with the United States.

Zero Day.name: Zero Day
Zero Day.plot: Two troubled adolescents chronicle the events that ultimately lead up to a terrifying assault on their school.

The Forest of Hands and Teeth.name: The Forest of Hands and Teeth
The Forest of Hands and Teeth.plot: Mary lives in a world where you must always mind the fence that protects the village from the Forest of Hands and Teeth.

Leviathan.name: Leviathan
Leviathan.plot: In a Russian coastal town, Kolya is forced to fight the corrupt mayor when he is told that his house will be demolished. He recruits a lawyer friend to help, but the man's arrival brings further misfortune for Kolya and his family.

Mother Night.name: Mother Night
Mother Night.plot: An American spy behind the lines during WWII serves as a Nazi propagandist, a role he cannot escape in his future life as he can never reveal his real role in the war.

Wither.name: Wither
Wither.plot: Ida and Albin are a happy couple. They set off to a cabin in the vast Swedish woodlands to have a fun holiday with their friends. But under the floorboards waits an evil from Sweden's dark past.

The Tommyknockers.name: The Tommyknockers
The Tommyknockers.plot: The movie is based on the 1987 Stephen King novel of the same name.

The Marriage Plot.name: The Marriage Plot
The Marriage Plot.plot: Things go awry when an undocumented immigrant meets a southern nerd at a top-secret program that helps couples attain legal immigration status unlawfully. The program inventor intervenes to preserve the program's reputation.

Messenger.name: Messenger
Messenger.plot: Take a ride with Kamikaze, New York City's most legendary bike messenger and world class character. Be a part of the action and learn the street wisdom he's gleaned about work, women and the meaning of life from his 25 years on NYC's streets.

House Rules.name: House Rules
House Rules.plot: A small group of people are forced to spend the night inside a mansion with a mysterious past. Will anyone survive the night.

Falling Up.name: Falling Up
Falling Up.plot: A nursing student (Cross) forced to quit school for family reasons winds up taking a job as a doorman in an elite apartment building in New York City, where he sparks to one of his residents (Roemer).

Torment.name: Torment
Torment.plot: When 4 crooks break into a house in search of the holy Grail, the owner takes them hostage and torments them.

Pandemonium.name: Pandemonium
Pandemonium.plot: A former high school student who always wanted to be a cheerleader decides to reopen the cheerleading program at her former high school after years of closure for being targeted by a serial killer.

Before I Fall.name: Before I Fall
Before I Fall.plot: February 12 is just another day in Sam's charmed life, until it turns out to be her last. Stuck reliving her last day over and over, Sam untangles the mystery around her death and discovers everything she's losing.

A Million Little Pieces.name: A Million Little Pieces
A Million Little Pieces.plot: A drug-dependent young man faces his past and his inner demons after he is interned in an institution for the addicted.

Odd Thomas.name: Odd Thomas
Odd Thomas.plot: In a California desert town, a short-order cook with clairvoyant abilities encounters a mysterious man with a link to dark, threatening forces.

Cutting for Stone.name: Cutting for Stone
Cutting for Stone.plot: A mystery, a drama, and a thriller. 18 year old Philip Renold finds himself trapped in the endless loop of seclusion rooms, injections, pills and nightmares of a mental hospital.

Cinder.name: Cinder
Cinder.plot: Young Cinder grows up an orphan and must learn to survive alone in a dark post-modern underworld of deceit greed, yet still somehow finds love. After she runs away, her modern "prince" has to think outside of the box to find her.

Dark Places.name: Dark Places
Dark Places.plot: Libby Day was only eight years old when her family was brutally murdered in their rural Kansas farmhouse. Almost thirty years later, she reluctantly agrees to revisit the crime and uncovers the wrenching truths that led up to that tragic night.

The Art of Racing in the Rain.name: The Art of Racing in the Rain
The Art of Racing in the Rain.plot: Through his bond with his owner, aspiring Formula One race car driver Denny, golden retriever Enzo learns that the techniques needed on the racetrack can also be used to successfully navigate the journey of life.

The Selection.name: The Selection
The Selection.plot: In a dystopian world, thirty-five girls are chosen to participate in the "Selection", live in the palace, and compete for the heart of Prince Maxon. But for America Singer, being selected is a true nightmare.

Beautiful Disaster.name: Beautiful Disaster
Beautiful Disaster.plot: College freshman, Abby, tries to distance herself from her dark past while resisting her attraction to bad boy, Travis.

Crescendo.name: Crescendo
Crescendo.plot: When world-famous conductor Eduard Sporck accepts the job to create an Israeli-Palestinian youth orchestra, he is quickly drawn into a tempest of sheer unsolvable problems.

The Night Circus.name: The Night Circus
The Night Circus.plot: A story set in a mysterious circus and centered around two young magicians vying for supremacy under the close watch of their respective instructors.

Matched.name: Matched
Matched.plot: A provocative character driven story that explores the obsessions, betrayals and psychosis of online dating. The movie is a modern day comedy-thriller that exposes our deepest desires, fears and vulnerabilities through online dating.

Fifty Shades Freed.name: Fifty Shades Freed
Fifty Shades Freed.plot: Anastasia and Christian get married, but Jack Hyde continues to threaten their relationship.

Fifty Shades Darker.name: Fifty Shades Darker
Fifty Shades Darker.plot: While Christian wrestles with his inner demons, Anastasia must confront the anger and envy of the women who came before her.

The Neon Bible.name: The Neon Bible
The Neon Bible.plot: While on a train, a teenage boy thinks about his life and the flamboyant aunt whose friendship acted as an emotional shield from his troubled family. This film evokes the haunting quality of memory while creating a heartfelt portrait of a boy's life in a rural 1940s Southern town.

Summer of the Monkeys.name: Summer of the Monkeys
Summer of the Monkeys.plot: Summer Of The Monkeys (set in 1910 on the prairies of Canada) follows the story of a young boy, Jay, who dreams of getting enough money to buy his dream horse. One summer Jay finds four chimps on the prairie who have fallen off a circus cart. He later learns that there is a big reward for them. Enough to buy the horse... however, as time goes on he befriends the chimps... and it becomes apparent that Jay can't bear to part with them.

Where I Belong.name: Where I Belong
Where I Belong.plot: The politics of the Third Reich drove thousands into exile. For many, England was the first safe haven. When the war came to an end the world as they knew it had changed forever and many would not return to their homeland.

Passing.name: Passing
Passing.plot: Siblings Andy and Zach are stuck in lockdown in two different houses and their own heads, forcing them to come to terms with their relationship before it collapses under the weight of their neuroses.

Dead or Alive.name: Dead or Alive
Dead or Alive.plot: Jack Stokes is Sheriff Lamar's right-hand man. Mrs. Lamar receives a threatening letter from a gambler. He threatens to expose her former life if she does not persuade the Sheriff to give him free play. Jack overhears the conversation. In the fight which follows, the gambler is accidentally killed. His gang tries to lynch Jack. He is released from prison by Mrs. Lamar, and escapes. Tom Stone and Jim Bland are outlaws. Tom receives a letter from his sister informing him of her journey west. They resolve to hold up the "Oasis," a dance hall and saloon, and with the money send the girl East again. The robbery is easily accomplished, but Bland is fatally wounded. He dies, and Tom puts his own name on the grave's crosspiece, thus hoping to throw the posse oft his trail. Jack sees the grave and conceives the same idea. He places his name on the crosspiece. In leaving he sees Tom's coat and finds Beulah's picture and the swag. He goes to the "Oasis" and there rescues Beulah from the life of a dance hall girl, claiming she is his sister. Through unforeseen circumstances Jack is accused of robbing the "Oasis." He is about to be hung but escapes. At a deserted cabin he finds the real Tom, who has been badly wounded while holding up a stage coach. The sheriffs from the two towns arrive. Sheriff Lamar clears Jack, and Beulah decides that she would rather have Jack as husband than brother.

Broken Silence.name: Broken Silence
Broken Silence.plot: Winter, 1944. Lucía at 21 returns to her small village in the mountains. She again meets Manuel, a young iron-smith who helps "those in the mountain", the "maquis", the anti-Franco resistance. Lucía is attracted to Manual, because of his smile and the bravery of those men who continue fighting for their ideas, even at the cost of their own lives. When Manuel is pursued (by Franco's Civil Guard) he flees to the mountain and Lucía discovers the reality of political repression, the silence, the horror and fear.

Anyone But You.name: Anyone But You
Anyone But You.plot: After an amazing first date, Bea and Ben's fiery attraction turns ice-cold--until they find themselves unexpectedly reunited at a wedding in Australia. So they do what any two mature adults would do: pretend to be a couple.

Unseen.name: Unseen
Unseen.plot: A blind, undocumented immigrant from Mexico, Pedro is an aspiring social worker who dreams of securing a job after graduation to support his family and provide mental health services for underserved communities.

Sever.name: Sever
Sever.plot: A violent patient escapes an asylum to exact her revenge on a unsuspecting young couple.

La fiesta del chivo.name: La fiesta del chivo
La fiesta del chivo.plot: Urania Cabral (Isabella Rossellini) returns to Santo Domingo, after several years, and remembers her and her family's relationship to Rafael Leonidas Trujillo (Tomas Milian), the Dominican dictator, as well as the events surrounding his assassination.

Paradise.name: Paradise
Paradise.plot: The daily routine in an American town depicted through stop-motion tin miniatures.

Two By Two.name: Two By Two
Two By Two.plot: Quacky Whack tries to get on Noah's Ark. Hilarity ensures.

Stars Above.name: Stars Above
Stars Above.plot: A story of a house and three women of different generations who inhabit it through the years.

Marina.name: Marina
Marina.plot: The true story of Rocco Granata, an Italian coal miner's son who followed his passion for music against his father's wishes and social barriers.

China Dolls.name: China Dolls
China Dolls.plot: Born into the underground world of human trafficking and prostitution, luck gave Jerri and Marie one chance to break free. They took it and now the mob wants them back...with interest.

Eyes wide open.name: Eyes wide open
Eyes wide open.plot: An American student in Seoul, South Korea uses his skills as a spy to stop foreign agents and local gang members from gaining access to a supercomputer that can connect to anyone and anything.

The Wonder.name: The Wonder
The Wonder.plot: The Plot starts in the middle of the story and reveals the conversation between main character Nathaniel and his old friend Eli and ELi's mysterious and quiet side kick Caldecut Hu. After catching Eli and Caldecut up to his present condition and predicament, the story takes a turn into the present experience of Nathaniel. The story then continues to trace and capture Nathaniel's strange and painful reality full of memory and a strange cast of life surrounding him.

Whispers.name: Whispers
Whispers.plot: A woman is stalked by a psychopathic killer. She eventually kills him, only for the man to show up again, this time sane and without any knowledge of the attacks. The police don't believe her, but one detective agrees to look into it.

Who Do You Love.name: Who Do You Love
Who Do You Love.plot: The life story of legendary record producer Leonard Chess, founder of Chess Records, the label that helped popularize Blues music during the 1950s and '60s.

Tom Sawyer & Huckleberry Finn.name: Tom Sawyer & Huckleberry Finn
Tom Sawyer & Huckleberry Finn.plot: Tom Sawyer and his pal Huckleberry Finn have great adventures on the Mississippi River, pretending to be pirates, attending their own funeral and witnessing a murder.

Cause of Death.name: Cause of Death
Cause of Death.plot: A deputy-district attorney, assigned to investigate the murder of the mayor's cousin, finds himself falling for the victim's wife.

Vanish.name: Vanish
Vanish.plot: A kidnapped young woman is forced on a road trip full of murder and mayhem that takes place entirely in her captor's getaway van.

The Secret Place.name: The Secret Place
The Secret Place.plot: A beautiful redhead becomes involved with a group of small-time hoodlums who plan and perform a daring diamond robbery.

That Summer.name: That Summer
That Summer.plot: Montauk, East Hampton, New York, 2016. Peter Beard discusses his work as a photographer, artist and diarist before reminiscing about his attempt to make a documentary in the summer of 1972 with his friend Lee Radziwill (younger sister of Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis), focusing on their childhood and the 20th- century history of East Hampton.

All in.name: All in
All in.plot: A conflicted artist's gruff cartoon strip character comes to life to help him set his life's priorities.

Us.name: Us
Us.plot: Six childhood friends reunite for one wild and crazy night.

The Red Queen.name: The Red Queen
The Red Queen.plot: A young software engineer ventures into a vivid journey to study a newly developed A.I. interface.

The Buried Giant.name: The Buried Giant
The Buried Giant.plot: The journey of Axl and Beatrice, a couple who set off on a journey to find their son, who they have not seen for some time, and actually do not remember very well.

This Girl.name: This Girl
This Girl.plot: A boy obsesses over a girl who barely gives him the time of day. Uncertain as to how to impress her, he tries everything he can think of...literally.

We Are Water.name: We Are Water
We Are Water.plot: We Are Water is an imaginative, enlightening documentary illustrating the fragile relationship between our modern society and our fresh water resources. Told from the perspective of Jill Heinerth, the world's top female scuba diver, the film takes viewers on a breathtaking visceral journey inside the watery underground rivers and caves of our aquifer. A positive, solutions based approach to our physical and spiritual connection to water, the source of life.

The Complete Works.name: The Complete Works
The Complete Works.plot: Fifteen years in the making, The Complete Works is a visual tour de force that adapts the work of internationally acclaimed avant-garde poet bpNichol to the screen.

Wedding Night.name: Wedding Night
Wedding Night.plot: A young, sensitive girl becomes panicky on her wedding night with an overpowering fear of marital sex and ultimate pregnancy.

Dreamland.name: Dreamland
Dreamland.plot: Dan Freeman an obsessive UFO Hunter roams the Nevada desert around AREA 51 searching the skies for contact, but alone in the desert he awakens to a deeper mystery.

Seveneves.name: Seveneves
Seveneves.plot: A colony of survivors living in outer space try to return to Earth thousands of years after it was evacuated.

Winter.name: Winter
Winter.plot: A tragic love story following successful artist Woods after his beloved wife's death and exploring the effects his crippling grief has on his two young sons.

Truly Madly Guilty.name: Truly Madly Guilty
Truly Madly Guilty.plot: In Australia, three married couples attend a backyard barbecue that goes horribly wrong.

Luckiest Girl Alive.name: Luckiest Girl Alive
Luckiest Girl Alive.plot: A woman in New York, who seems to have things under control, is faced with a trauma that makes her life unravel.

To All the Boys I've Loved Before.name: To All the Boys I've Loved Before
To All the Boys I've Loved Before.plot: A teenage girl's secret love letters are exposed and wreak havoc on her love life.

Landline.name: Landline
Landline.plot: In 1995, a teenager living with her sister and parents in Manhattan discovers that her father is having an affair.

Batman: The Killing Joke.name: Batman: The Killing Joke
Batman: The Killing Joke.plot: As Batman hunts for the escaped Joker, the Clown Prince of Crime attacks the Gordon family to prove a diabolical point mirroring his own fall into madness.

Inheritance.name: Inheritance
Inheritance.plot: A woman learns her estranged father has died and returns with her brother and new lover to her childhood home of Belize, where she must face her past while fighting for intimacy in the present.

Hopeless.name: Hopeless
Hopeless.plot: For the last two years, Ben has watched his best friend Phil have a sickeningly fantastic relationship with Maryann, the woman Phil snatched from under his nose. When Phil says he's moving to Australia, this 'perfect' relationship starts to fall apart. Maryann asks Ben to fix things up. Unfortunately the more time Ben spends with Maryann, the more he's attracted to her.

Peter Pan.name: Peter Pan
Peter Pan.plot: The Darling family children receive a visit from Peter Pan, who takes them to Never Never Land where an ongoing war with the evil Pirate Captain Hook is taking place.

Under the Dome.name: Under the Dome
Under the Dome.plot: A documentary about pollution in China and how it has affected the lives of Chinese people.

The Light Between Oceans.name: The Light Between Oceans
The Light Between Oceans.plot: A lighthouse keeper and his wife living off the coast of Western Australia raise a baby they rescue from a drifting rowing boat.

A Tree Grows In Brooklyn.name: A Tree Grows In Brooklyn
A Tree Grows In Brooklyn.plot: Encouraged by her idealistic if luckless father, a bright and imaginative young woman comes of age in a Brooklyn tenement during the early 1900s.

The Gunslinger.name: The Gunslinger
The Gunslinger.plot: A reformed gun slinger loses his memory while attempting to stop a bank robbery by the McClure gang. After the McClure gang knocks Wichita Slim (Kenneth Copeland) unconscious during the robbery, causing him to lose his memory, they use him as a hostage to escape, and manipulate him into resuming his former life of crime.

Artemis Fowl.name: Artemis Fowl
Artemis Fowl.plot: Artemis Fowl, a young criminal prodigy, hunts down a secret society of fairies to find his missing father.

The Tragedy of Macbeth.name: The Tragedy of Macbeth
The Tragedy of Macbeth.plot: A Scottish lord becomes convinced by a trio of witches that he will become the next King of Scotland, and his ambitious wife supports him in his plans of seizing power.

The Goldfinch.name: The Goldfinch
The Goldfinch.plot: A boy in New York is taken in by a wealthy family after his mother is killed in a bombing at the Metropolitan Museum of Art. In a rush of panic, he steals 'The Goldfinch', a painting that eventually draws him into a world of crime.

Dracula.name: Dracula
Dracula.plot: 8-minute shortened version of Tod Browning's 1931 classic "Dracula."

Mistress.name: Mistress
Mistress.plot: A weak man finds strength in a woman's arms.

True Colors.name: True Colors
True Colors.plot: Trevor Winfield is a former street thief turned painter, who is now in a relationship with his girlfriend Sophia Clifford. After he finds himself in debt to a drug lord, he is faced with the ultimatum of staging a heist against his wealthy girlfriend to pay back a debt.

The Cross and the Switchblade.name: The Cross and the Switchblade
The Cross and the Switchblade.plot: Long before faith-based films became a regular feature of mainstream movie theaters, there was "The Cross and The Switchblade," the story of Pastor David Wilkerson and gang member Nicky Cruz.
